availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Richeson Barnett (Green County Farmer and Presiding Judge)

body.p: Kentucky farmer and judge. Married to Susan A. Elmore Barnett. Father of Anne L. Barnett Marshall, William Thomas Barnett, Nancy Barnett, Mary K. Barnett Settle, and Warner Elmore Barnett. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860. Served as presiding judge of the Green County Court in 1860 and 1861.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District No. 2, p. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District No. 2, p. 1; "Thomas Richeson Barnett," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89610695&ref=acom), (accessed on March 20, 2017).
